com.magnet.mobile.android

Class MagnetMobileClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.mobile.android.MagnetMobileClient

  • public class MagnetMobileClient
extends Object
    MagnetMobileClient is a helper class which initializes kernel and basic connection services to the Magnet Management Server and Magnet Enterprise Server. It also provides a method to perform injection for injectable Magnet objects.

    Sample code showing how to use this class to establish connection to server and inject data: 

        // Initialize Magnet kernel services and do data inject now.
    MagnetMobileClient sHelper = new MagnetMobileClient(context.getApplicationContext());
    sHelper.startKernel(context, null);
    sHelper.injectNow(this);

    // Register connection listeners
    sHelper.registerConnectionListener(new ConnectionServiceListener() {
        @Override
      public boolean onConnectionEvent(ConnectionService ocs, Event event) {
         Log.d(TAG, "onConnectionEvent: " + event);
         switch (event) {
         case CONNECTED:
         case AUTHENTICATED:
         case BAD_CREDENTIALS:
         case DISCONNECTED:
         case CONNECTING:
         case UNAUTHENTICATED:
         }
         return true;
       }
    });

    // Connect to Mobile Server using single-sign-on.
    ConnectionService conSvc = sHelper.getConnectionService();
    if (!(conSvc.isConnecting() || conSvc.isConnected())) {
       sHelper.connect();
    }
    The following sample code sets its own credentials and makes a connection to the server, http://my.host.com:8080 

        ConnectionPreferences prefs = sHelper.obtainPreferences();
    prefs.username("magnet1");
    prefs.password("test".getBytes());
    prefs.authority("magnet");
    prefs.protocol("http");
    prefs.hostname("my.host.com");
    prefs.port("8080");
    sHelper.connect(prefs);

    Additionally, general Magnet app settings are stored in Android shared preferences and there are two ways to get an instance. Refer to AndroidSettingsConstants for a list of available settings.

    1. Via Android API, Context.getSharedPreferences(String name, int mode),
    where name=com.magnet.mobile.android.settings.AndroidSettingsConstants.MAGNET_SHARED_PREFERENCE_FILE_NAME

    2. Via @Inject construct. For example: 

       @Inject
   @Named(com.magnet.mobile.android.AndroidSharedPreferencesProvider.DEFAULT_NAME)
   private Reference sharedPrefs;

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
                throws com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException
        Connect to Magnet Server via Mobile Server ibinder interface with single sign on using account credentials from the Mobile Server account. Caller should use ConnectionServiceListener.onConnectionEvent(ConnectionService, com.magnet.connection.ConnectionServiceListener.Event) for the connection result. If there is an established connection, calling this method will disconnect the connection and establish a new one.
        Returns:
        true
        Throws:
        com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException - Magnet-kernel is not started.
        See Also:
        getConnectionState()

      • connect

        public boolean connect(String username,
              String password,
              String authority)
                throws com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException
        Connect to Magnet Server via mobile server ibinder interface with its own credential. Saves credential in encrypted form to persistent storage whether the connection is success or not. Caller should use ConnectionServiceListener.onConnectionEvent(ConnectionService, com.magnet.connection.ConnectionServiceListener.Event) for the connection result.
        Returns:
        true
        Throws:
        com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException - Magnet-kernel is not started.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(com.magnet.mobile.android.ConnectionPreferences preferences)
                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                       com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException
        Connect to Magnet Server using the specified preferences. The connection parameters and credential will be encrypted and persisted in a storage regardless the connection is success or not. If prefs is null, it is same as calling connect(). An instance of ConnectionPreferences must be obtained from obtainPreferences(). Typically this is used to make http or https connection with explicit user credential, in contrast to invoking connect(). Caller should implement and register ConnectionServiceListener.onConnectionEvent(ConnectionService, com.magnet.connection.ConnectionServiceListener.Event) for the connection result. The caller should use {
        Parameters:
        prefs - null, or an instance of ConnectionPreferences.
        Returns:
        true
        Throws:
        com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException - Magnet-kernel is not started.
        IllegalArgumentException - The preferences object is not from obtainPreferences()

      • isProxyServerEnabled

        public boolean isProxyServerEnabled()
        Check if Mobile Server is enabled. If the Mobile Server is enabled, the client app can use connect() to send all requests via it. If the Mobile Server is not available, the client app must use connect(ConnectionPreferences) to connect to the app server directly. However, the current implementation does not detect if the Mobile Server is fully configured due to the maven dependency issue.
        Returns:
        true if Mobile Server is enabled; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        connect(), connect(ConnectionPreferences)

      • connect

        public boolean connect(String username,
              String password,
              String authority,
              String protocol,
              String host,
              int port,
              String sslType,
              String appId)
                throws com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException
        Deprecated. Use connect(ConnectionPreferences) instead.
        Connect to Magnet Server directly via http. Saves connection parameters and credential in encrypted form to persistent storage whether successful or not.
        Parameters:
        username - user login name
        password - user password
        authority - user login authority, for example, "magnet"
        protocol - "http" or "https".
        host - network address or name of the Magnet server
        port - port number of the Magnet server
        sslType - Required if using "https" protocol. Possible values are: anonymous, one_way, two_way, trust_all_certs
        appId - null or a name to the server as configured by proxy server; consult your deployment team.
        Returns:
        true; use ConnectionServiceListener for connection result
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Invalid protocol
        com.magnet.common.PlatformRuntimeException - Magnet-kernel is not started.

      • getConnectionState

        public MagnetMobileClient.ConnectionState getConnectionState()
        Return the current connection state. Caller should check the connection state before invoking any connect() methods.
        Returns:
        A ConnectionState enum value

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
        Disconnects from server. Note that network connection can be alive to the server without being authenticated. This method makes a network request to disconnect and per Android limitation, it must be invoked on a separate thread, not MAIN thread.
        Returns:
        true if disconnecting; false if not connected

      • injectNow

        public void injectNow(Object container)
        Perform the data injection to the container. A container is any object (e.g. Activity, Application...) that contains field members to be injected. The startKernel(Object, Bundle) must be called prior to this method; otherwise, it will be no-op.
        Parameters:
        container - A container object.
        See Also:
        startKernel(Object, Bundle)

      • obtainPreferences

        public static com.magnet.mobile.android.ConnectionPreferences obtainPreferences()
        Obtain an instance of connection preferences to be used for call to connect(ConnectionPreferences)
        Returns:
        An instance of connection preferences.
        See Also:
        connect(ConnectionPreferences)
